Over the years the number of foreign donors increased and many children were helped in their education. With support from other donor agencies Calcutta-SEED also has undertaken developmental activities like building houses for those suffered from natural calamities, youth development etc

title: calcuttabahari
detailsOfAchievement: Calcutta Bahari is a well known leading theatre & cultural, social development organization. Through out this period group has produced 26 fulllenghth drama and have performed 360 shows in different stages of Bengal as well as India. Group generly perform 25 shows annully. That includes several one act plays & street shows.We also working among rural urban areas, Landless peasants, marginal farmers, share coppers, distitute womens, poor children, labour-class areas to create awarness among social economic development through differnt NGOs of Govt. of India and Govt. of West Bengal. SEMINAR & SYMPOSIUM : It has been organized in renowed auditorium, schools, colleges, market, rural area & other important location of various social & cultural issues in the field of Comunal harmony, crisis of modern theatre, folk & rural and tribal art, RESEARCH WORK : A research work on lyrical theatre is going on directed by Sri Anupam Roy, also doing research work on tribal & traditional rural folk arts fordevelopment, preservation, mordanise in the purose of folk theatre. AWARDS : Bahari has received RANGAKAL award 2005 for the drama RAMRAMA RANGALILA which is running for last14 years.Also received best production of the Year 2008 given by ANUBHAB NATYA SANGSTHA for drama ARSHI. IN HOUSE WORKSHOP : It has been organizing since last 8 years by renowned & reputed theatre personalities and senior member & Guru. Also we had conducted workshop & production participated and performed by the school students, street child and slum children. REMARKABLE PRODUCTION & INVITIONS: RARAMA RANGALILA, MEHEJAN, ASHMAPTA ADHYAY, ANCHAL,DUI KADA etc. Kolkata Dooradarshan telecated documentary performance of lyrical theatre along with an interview of the director. Full length drama MEHERJAAN telecasted by Kolkata Dooradarshan and HATHAT DEKHA of Tagore. Audio drama ANCHAL boradcated from AIR Kolkata KA.Natya Mela of Govt. of West Bengal, Rabindra Jayanti, Vidyasagar Meal, Purulia Zella Utsab, Srijan Utsab - tribal & Folk. Participated in World leteracy Day, International Womens Festival in Kolkata, Ganga Jamuna Internatiional Festuval in Kolkata. Different Autumns Festivals in NEW DELHI, MOMBAI & HYDRABAD. Group has already achieved a few musical insturments, theatrical equipments and essential material for office work. The group has geared up talented full time theatre performers and Workers. Also proviedes them a little remuneratiion. GURU PRANAM AND FELICITATION : In different occaddion Bahari organized felicitation programme in their differnt festivalsto the emiment personalities of the society.

detailsOfAchievement: Cancer Foundation of India works for cancer prevention and control since 2002. Our core focus is on Cancer Public Health, Cancer screening, Capacity building, Research and Development, Post-treatment services and counselling.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: This project involves developing a research document with material researched from Classical Indian medical texts.

The Network Programme on Cancer in Women for North East India is a unique Breast Cancer prevention initiative for Northeastern (NE) States with a view to generate baseline data essential for further work through multi-centre community intervention. The project coordinated by CFI in four different states of Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram and Tripura involved community awareness on early signs of breast cancer and setting up of the first exclusive Breast clinic in the state.

detailsOfAchievement: Advancing effective principled education policies in Governments, Higher Education Institutes and Civil Societies for improving Better sustainable Livelihood. Defending Human rights is the core of our basic campaign Education Charter International. "The International Education charter is a declaration of fundamental principles for building a just, sustainable educated youth of global society for the 21st century. Created by global civil society CCLP Worldwide, endorsed by thousands of members, volunteers , organizations and institutions and individual engaged endorsing youth the Charter is not only a call to action, but a motivating force inspiring change the world over. detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities Activities : Centre for Social Development was established in the year 1985 with the sold object of building a community based on health, education, child and economic and social empowerment of under privileged women labour in rural areas. The main beneficiaries of our programme are the poor, illiterate, ill-fed and nutritionally deficient children and women in those areas. Project and Particulars of Work done : The following programme have been conducted by csd : ïƒ˜ Integrated Programmne for Welfare of Street and Working Children in certain sectors in Kolkata supported financially by Govt. of India (Ministry of Women and Child Developoment). ïƒ˜ Sikshalaya Prakalpa from 1999 on Mainstreaming & supporting Education for 25 Streets & Working Children by dint of 1 such education centers being run at South Kolkata in collaboration with CLPOA under financial support from Govt. of West Bengal. ïƒ˜ The Integrated Child Protection Scheme â€“ permission granted to CSD for the month of December. This Scheme is extended to 25 Children in Need of Care and Protection and children in conflict and contact with the law. ïƒ˜ Our Organisation conducted 5 numbers of workshops with 100 numbers of women labour by the legal practitioner to generate awareness and give training about various rights laws. ïƒ˜ To generate awareness among the women labours also discuss about the benefit of the labour laws, and give idea about the probation of various labours laws also trained them how to use these laws in their work and stop discrimination. ïƒ˜ Conducted 4 numbers of workshop programme by the expert with 100 numbers of women labour about some Government scheme that help to them for avail under different schemes. ïƒ˜ Health Program which would serve the interest of the Poorest members of the urban and rural localities. ïƒ˜ Education Program which would serve the interest of the poorest members of the urban and rural localities in which h CSD is active. ïƒ˜ Vocational Training & HIV Awareness. ïƒ˜ Awareness of Womenâ€™s empowerment, Womenâ€™s right, prevention of child labour. CSD has focused to build a community based health and education programme, which would serve for the interest of the poorest members of the urban and rural localities. The main clientele and beneficiaries are the poor, illiterate, ill fed and nutritionally deficient children and women in those areas. So, the programme aims to make the helpless people self-reliant and self-sufficient. CSD has also focused its attention on curricular activities and recreation to channelize the energies of children they work with. The organization has endeavored to raise public awareness through mass rallies, poster campaigns, on issues around child labour.CSD forms part of the City Lev el Programme of Action network in Kolkata ( a network of 50 NGOs working with street and working children and sin c e 1997. CSD has been functioning as a Nodal agency in South Zone in th Kolkata Plan of Action (now CLPOA) upto 2011. Currently we are involved in the implementation of awareness programme on HIV/AIDS in six villages and fourteen brick kilns in the district of 24-Parganas (N).

detailsOfAchievement: Centre Stage started its theatrical activities in 2009. It was founded with a group of experienced personnel in the field of Dance and Theatre and other cultural field like Music, Art, Mime and Movements, to create an environment in which children and young person can use drama to explore both the imaginative and the concrete world. Since then, Centre Stage has developed into a full performing arts centre and now offers creative programmes like â€“ drama, performance acting, musical theatre, dance theatre, music and art and craft for children of all ages, young and adults too! In 2011, Centre Stage has become as a Registered Organization (Regn. No. â€“ S/1L/80612 of 2011-12). Centre Stage has been engaged, along with regular Intensive Theatre Training Programme (In-House Programme and Outsides Self and Collaboration Programme) for Children and Young persons. i) Weekend Theatre Training Programme, ii) Weekdays Theatre Training Programme, iii) Summer Camp, iv) Winter Camp, v) Theatre with Children in formal school situation, vi) Theatre with marginalized and variously challenged Children and Youth, vii) Theatre with Youth, viii) Organizing Theatre Festivals/Performances, ix) Arranging collaborative Theatre Actions with Theatre troupes and individuals from various districts in West Bengal, and so on. Productions and Performances of In-house Productions like â€“ (a) Haraye Khunji (Childrenâ€™s Friendly) for and by the Children. Playwright, Music and Direction â€“ Nabanita Mukherjee Das and Swarup Das (b) Prastab (based on Anton Chekhovâ€™s The Mrriage Proposal, adapted by Ajitesh Bandopadhyay), Music and Direction by Swarup Das So far last few years Centre Stage has been organized two Theatre Festivalsâ€“ (a) â€œShishu-Kishore Natya Shandhyaâ€ (An Evening with Children and Youth Plays) on 5th October, 2013 with two plays. In this evening Centre Stage presents HARAYE KHUNJI â€“ Drama & Direction â€“ Nabanita Mukherjee Das and Swarup Das and Naye Natua Presents BARDA BARDA â€“ based on Munshi Premchandaâ€™s Bade Bhai Sahab, Direction and Performance by Goutam Halder. (b) â€œDeshio o Europeo Ekanko-Natya Shandhyaâ€ (An Evening with Indinan & European One-Act Plays) on 8th June, 2014 In this evening Centre Stage Presents two plays â€“ HARAYE KHUNJI, Drama & Direction â€“ Nabanita Mukherjee Das & Swarup Das and PRASTAB, based on Anton Chekhovâ€™s The Marriage Proposal, Adaptation by Ajitesh Bandopadhyay, Music, DÃ©cor & Direction â€“ Swarup Das. The aim of all Centre Stage programmes is to Unlock the Creative Potential in Us All.

title: Cine Guild Bally
detailsOfAchievement: Apart from regular artistic film screening, we hold Seminars, Adda (informal discussion on certain issues) on film and allied arts say, Literature, Music, Painting, Sculpture, Social, Socio-political issues etc. We also publish a news bulletin of our organization with the title "Cine Guild, Bulletin" which consists of articles on some specific issues such as tribute to the just deceased dignatories (obituary), centenary tribute to the noted personalities in the field of art and culture, organizational news, film criticism, article on very contemporary socio-political issues, programme news etc. This news bulletin is a bimonthly one and is generally published at least 5 issues a year. We also publish a magazine titled as "Prasanga Chalacchitra" . We have so far published 16 issues of this magazine. Our financial constarint is the main reason for not publishing the magazine once a year. Our last 4 issues have been widely acclaimed by the people and critic. The 13th issue focussed on the relation of film art with other art mediums , namely literature, music, poetry, painting etc. and also gave a brief presentation on the people whose birth centenary is falling between 2000 & 2005. The next issue was on ace cinematographer Subrata Mitra. The 15th issue was on film director Tapan Sinha. The last one that is 16th issue was on art director Banshi Chandragupta. We have organised Painting exhibition,Photography exhibition, Science exhibition , exhibition of books and magazines etc a no. of times before and for last 2 years we are doing these programme ritually during the time of Annual Film Festivals being organised in collaboration with local Municipality.We have also organised Health Check-up camp for the aged people and for the vegetable and fish sellers of the local market in the last year.We organise at least one slide show on trekking, one drama by invited drama group, one picnic of the members of the society, one musical evening and a vijaya sammilani every year for last 4 years. We have organised film appreciation course in the past with the particiaption of local college students.

detailsOfAchievement: Community Led Total Sanitation Foundation, CLTS Approach, provides strategic advisory support, builds capacity, undertakes cutting-edge research and builds knowledge to assist sanitation programme implementation. The organization has worked in Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal in India. The organization has also developed knowledge material focusing on sanitation, behavior change, best practices, methodology and community empowerment for larger dissemination.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: To build and strengthen the capacity and core competencies of CLTS Foundation to cater to growing need of support for CLTS implementation with quality at scale. To foster innovation and generate practitioner’s knowledge for nuanced field implementation of CLTS as one of the key driver of change with regard to sanitation and poverty eradication through local empowerment. To leverage the expertise and reach out of Dr. Kamal Kar for policy and academic influence on global sanitation initiatives.

CLTS Foundation has established sound organisational systems including HR and Finance. The Foundation underwent a rigorous strategic planning process in 2016. The planning process enabled the Foundation to conduct an analysis of external context and their strengths as an institution and plan ways forward. The Foundation has invested in organizational development activities and has made significant progress in strengthening the capacity and competencies of its operational staff and management.

CLTS Foundation has established its global presence as a key partner for national governments, development organisations, international and local NGOs and civil society actors, towards achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) sanitation goals in the decade ahead. During the Millennium Development Goals (MDG) period, a significant shift has been observed from the provision of direct subsidies for toilet construction to facilitation of collective behaviour change to end open defecation.

title: COMPASS
detailsOfAchievement: Compass, Cooch Behar came into existence in the year 1992. The sole motto of this theatre group is to make theatre workers through scientific method and to share with the human values through Productions. Every year we organize a theatre festival. Many renowned teams from different corners of Bengal and other states participated in our festival. In the year 2007 we organized a International Theatre Festival at Cooch Behar. In the year 1995 our Production AMOD performed at Jorhat, Assam NSD Theatre Workshop. In the year 2001 our Production Akasher Opare Akash invited at Bharat Ranga Mahotsav,New Delhi, Ganayan Natyotsav, Bangladesh and Ganakrishthi Festival, Kolkata. We worked in many awareness programme with Consumers Affairs Department, Government of West Bengal, Unicef, Ministry of Petrolium, Government of India . We also organized Production Oriented Theatre Workshop with the prisoners at Correctional Home, Cooch Behar, Inmates of Government Girls Home, Cooch Behar and also organized four Production Oriented Theatre Workshop with School Children of Cooch Behar district with the help of Ministry of Tourism & Culture, Human Resource Development Department, Government of India.. We have so far produced 9(nine) full length plays and five one act plays and 14(fourteen) street plays during the span of 17 years. Our remarkable productions are DEWAN GAJIR KISSA (Written by Asadujjaman Nur,Bangladesh, Directed by Debabrata Acharya), BITE (Written & Directed by Debabrata Acharjya), MAHUA UPAKSHAN ( Written & Directed by Debabrata Acharya), GHORAR DIMER GOPPO (Written by Kaushik Chattopaddhyay, Directed by Partha Bandyopaddhyay), ABORTO ( Written & Directed by Debabrata Acharya) , HEU (Written by Saumitra Basu and Directed by Debabrata Acharya), CHOP ADALAT CHALCHE( Directed by Debabrata Acharya). In the year 2010 MAHUA UPAKSHAN awarded with Academy award by West Begal Government as the best full length play.

title: Curtain Call
detailsOfAchievement: Curtain Call, a new introduction in the theatre fraternity of Kolkata, believes in making and production of good theatre for the people and for the society through the continuous theatre learning process. In the process of achieving desired objective, we cannot deny the need for undergoing in depth theoretical and practical training in the field of every discipline of theatre. The organization, established by a bunch of theatre workers having an all round experience and exposure to the field, has designed its plan to produce all types of theatre in different format like proscenium and intimate theatre. Apart from production of theatre, Curtain Call has the objective of holding of seminars, debates, discussions, symposiums, lectures, talk-sessions on the subject related to drama and allied activities, to conduct theatre workshop under the supervision & instruction of learned personalities from national & international level engaged in the field of drama and its allied areas with the participation from the group and outside theatre activists, to organise theatre training programme for the children, to hold theatre festival including children theatre festival at Kolkata, in the state of West Bengal or elsewhere. Curtain Call is also intend to carry out research oriented activities in the field of drama and its allied activities and to construct a studio theatre for production and exhibition of in-house theatre throughout the year.
